DOC.brief_summary: This is an international, multicenter, prospective, non controlled, non randomized, clinical study to collect electrical impedance data of potentially malignant pigmented nevi and histological diagnoses (International Melanoma Algorithm Training Study [IMATS]). The study objective is to collect data for training and optimization of an algorithm that can classify skin lesions using electrical impedance, i.e., to identify malignant melanomas.
DOC.brief_title: International Melanoma Algorithm Training Study - IMATS
DOC.criteria: Men and women of any ethnic group Lesion located on normal healthy skin Maximum number of eight lesions per patient etc. Lesion under finger and toe nails Lesion located on eczema, psoriasis areas or similar Lesion located on scars etc.
